intro: Onosma asperrima, commonly known as the rough onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has a compact, low-growing habit with multiple stems and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
